definition: "hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to take advantage of sb/to freeload

sentences.english: He stiffened and wiped his face with the back of his hand.
sentences.chinese: 这时，他板起了面孔，用手背揩往了眼泪。

sentences.english: He wiped his fingers on his trousersbefore going indoors.
sentences.chinese: 他用裤子将手指上的鼻涕揩干净，然后才回到屋内。

sentences.english: He drew his handkerchief from his pocket and wipeed his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 他从口袋拿出手帕揩了一下嘴巴。

sentences.english: I am really fed up with his freeloading.
sentences.chinese: 他这样揩我的油我实在是受不了。

sentences.english: Iwiped the sweat from my palms onto my pants.
sentences.chinese: 我把手上的汗渍往裤子上揩了揩。

sentences.english: Iwiped the sweat from my palms onto my pants.
sentences.chinese: 我把手上的汗渍往裤子上揩了揩。

sentences.english: Give me another.' Catherine pushed another to him, and wiped her face.
sentences.chinese: 凯瑟琳把另一杯推给他，揩揩他的脸。

sentences.english: Give me another.' Catherine pushed another to him, and wiped her face.
sentences.chinese: 凯瑟琳把另一杯推给他，揩揩他的脸。

sentences.english: Some grandpas poem draft, pass by didn't also what use, all was to wipe Mao paper.
sentences.chinese: 有些爷爷的诗稿，过去也没啥用，都当了揩腚纸。

sentences.english: The act or an instance of wiping.
sentences.chinese: 擦，抹，揩擦的行为或事例。

sentences.english: Wen wiped dry for his tears, asked her name.
sentences.chinese: 温总理为他揩干眼泪，问她叫什么名字。

sentences.english: I am too heartbroken to wipe tears out at all ?
sentences.chinese: “断肠人懒揩流泪眼”？若如此，可否译作。

sentences.english: You can help me do the wiping-up if you like.
sentences.chinese: 你愿意的话可以帮我把洗好的盘子揩干。

sentences.english: Mary both washes the dishes and dries them.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽不仅洗盘子，而且把它们揩干。

sentences.english: He was wiping his hands on a rag.

definition: to wipe/to erase/rubbing (brush stroke in painting)/to clean/to polish
to smear/to wipe/to erase/classifier for wisps of cloud, light-beams etc
to moisten/to be infected by/to receive benefit or advantage through a contact/to touch
to apply (ointment, powder)/to smear/to paint on
perspiration/sweat/CL:滴[di1],頭|头[tou2],身[shen1]/to be speechless (out of helplessness, embarrassment etc) (Internet slang used as an interjection)
see 可汗[ke4 han2], 汗國|汗国[han2 guo2]
to feel with the hand/to touch/to stroke/to grope/to steal/to abstract
to moisten/to dampen/to be steeped in/to be imbued with
